Los Angeles Griffith Observatory captured this stunning time-lapse footage...
...of a total lunar eclipse that took place in the early hours of Saturday morning.
The moon slipped fully into the Earth's shadow at 4:58 AM local time,...
...starting an eclipse which lasted for nearly five minutes,...
...but according to NASA will be the shortest eclipse for a century.
As the moon passed into the Earth's shadow, it turned a sort of burnt orange in color...
...which has earned this celestial event the nickname of a "Blood Moon."
